articles.author: Stephen Culp
articles.description: Wall Street drifted higher in light trading on Thursday, as firming bets of interest rate cuts in the coming year supported stock prices as market participants eyed a potential bull market confirmation.
articles.title: Wall St inches higher as S&P 500 flirts with bull market confirmation

articles.author: Chen Aizhu, Oksana Kobzeva
articles.description: U.S. sanctions pose a major obstacle to Russia's plans to increase exports of seaborne liquefied natural gas (LNG) to offset the decline in pipeline gas exports to Europe, analysts said, as expectations mount of delays to a flagship project.
articles.title: Russia faces mighty obstacle in western LNG sanctions

articles.author: David Shepardson, Valerie Insinna
articles.description: Airplane maker Boeing (BA.N) is urging airlines to inspect newer 737 MAX airplanes for a possible loose bolt in the rudder control system, the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) said on Thursday.
articles.title: Boeing urges 737 MAX inspections for possible loose bolt

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi (1810.HK) took the wraps off its first electric vehicle on Thursday and promptly announced it was aiming to become one of world's top five automakers.
articles.title: China's Xiaomi unveils first electric vehicle, plans to become top automaker

articles.author: Yuka Obayashi
articles.description: Oil prices steadied on Thursday after falling sharply in the previous session, as concerns eased about shipping disruptions along the Red Sea route even as tensions in the Middle East continued to rise.
articles.title: Oil prices stabilise as Red Sea transport disruptions ease

articles.author: Tatiana Bautzer, Lananh Nguyen
articles.description: When Ted Pick takes over as the new CEO of Morgan Stanley (MS.N) next week, the three-decade bank veteran's frank manner and steady hand will help him steer the firm through a dealmaking slump.
articles.title: Morgan Stanley's straight-talking new CEO Ted Pick taking charge

articles.author: Chen Chen Lin
articles.description: Singapore households are bracing for a sales tax hike that takes effect in the new year as the government shores up coffers ahead of an expected surge in social spending in the rapidly ageing city-state in the years ahead.
articles.title: Singapore readies sales tax hike as demographic crunch looms

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Bassam Masoud
articles.description: Israeli tanks advanced deep into a town in the central Gaza Strip on Thursday after days of relentless bombardment that forced tens of thousands of already displaced Palestinian families to flee in a new exodus.
articles.title: Israeli tanks advance deep into Gaza town after strikes cause new mass exodus

articles.author: Phil Stewart, David Latona, Angelo Amante
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden hoped to present a firm international response to Yemen's Houthi attacks on Red Sea shipping by launching a new maritime force, but a week after its launch many allies don't want to be associated with it, publicly, or at all.
articles.title: US allies reluctant on Red Sea task force

articles.author: Joey Roulette, Steve Gorman
articles.description: After weeks of false starts and delays, SpaceX teams prepared again on Thursday to launch the military's secretive X-37B robot spaceplane on its seventh mission, the first atop a rocket capable of delivering it to a higher orbit than ever before.
articles.title: US military's secretive X-37B spaceplane ready for launch to higher orbit
